reviews.review_msg: Yildiz classes are fun and full of useful information. One of my favourite profs at sfu. this is one of the a few classes in which i didnt fall asleep.

Course, SA326 (during the SFU TA strike). Professor was passionate about being a teacher, was enthusiastic and was determined to get students excited about course materials. Students were falsely accused of using AI and deducted marks without proof. Multiple classmates's grades suffered due to false accusations. Horrible marker.

Theory class with her was brutal. Although she is very intelligent and passionate, it was very hard to learn from her. Horrible lecturing style, hard-to-follow PowerPoint presentations, and very unclear grading criteria. She does not use Canvas. Definitely not accommodating to neurodivergent students either. Kind of rude/arrogant to students.

Shes nice and knowledgeable about what she teaches, but this was one of the worst sociology classes Ive taken at SFU. Her lectures had no structure, often going back and forth between 2 different PowerPoints in a class, she graded you based on criteria never given in assignment guidelines, and graded you based on the work of other classmates. Ugh

Incredible professor. She is very knowledgeable and although she will incorporate areas of her research into the class it is very informative. I have never learnt so much in one class. She is always willing to help with assignments and will help you understand things if you ask for help outside of class.

She sure is passionate about the topics but loves the sound of her own voice too much. Holds an unnecessarily long 4 hour lecture that is painfully boring. Way too much work for one class, and her grading makes no sense. Plus there was no opportunity to go over grades and receive reasonable feedback. Doesnt even use canvas. DO NOT TAKE AS ELECTIVE

she's a prof that is clearly passionate about her topics however tends to go on long tangents and doesn't often break down the material. With this class the material is very dry and dense therefore just the readings on its own is hard to comprehend. Her feedback on papers were very negative & not helpful. She also did not have any set out lec notes

Yildiz has been my favourite professor of my undergrad, hands down. She is a fair marker, but be sure to pay attention to the syllabus for assignment instructions; everything you need to know is there. On top of being a great prof, she is very kind and understanding. I wish I had the time in my undergrad to take more courses with her.

The length and difficulty of the readings & how many readings there are, is completely unreasonable, esp for 3rd year. She is very cold and will not talk about/negotiate grades. The criteria for the summaries and critical journals are VERY important, if you make a mistake she will give NO sympathy. Repetitive lectures.
Kind and caring woman who pushes you to expand your critical thinking further.
The course was very interesting. She is very inspirational for me. Lots of interesting discussions and readings. She is fair and very supportive.

This is a must-take for any sociology student. Yildiz is an incredible woman, super kind and interesting and passionate, and is really good at getting to know the class and making it a really comfertable and open space. There are a fair amount of weekly readings, but all are great, and assignments are easy if you do the readings. A feminists dream!

Soul destroying course with a professor who was hellbent on making it the worst experience of my lifetime. I had to report her to the Dean and Associate Dean of Arts and Social Sciences.  Changes policies and course outline to suit her own agenda. Avoid at all costs. You will get a bad mark and will hate sociology.

This course is highly politically-focused and reading intensive. I found it difficult to sit through 4 hours of being talked at. Yildiz is highly knowledgeable about theorists of sociology, and though she encourages discussion, I found her demeanor discouraging as she tends to argue against students' thoughts somewhat aggressively.

This is my 2nd time taking a class with Yildiz. I have always enjoyed her classes and I try to work harder because I don't want to let her down. Very helpful during office hours. Class structure: 2x journals (easy if u put time in), presentation, presenting news & 5 news article summaries related w/ course concepts (found this to be annoying).

Yildiz was a fair marker, and was personally encouraging to me. Was always at office hours to answer my questions. I have to say that so far, this was one of the best courses I have taken at SFU. At the end of semester I felt like I had learned a lot. Do go to class and make sure you keep up with the readings. No midterms or final.

She is awesome!  Her teaching style is not for the linear mind. She makes you work and class participation is mandatory. She stimulates great conversation in class; doesn't use power point, yeah!; and has no final exam. This was a great class!

This was a great class. I recommend taking any course with Yildiz. She is one of the best profs I have had at SFU. She is a fair marker, cares about her students and she creates a unique learning environment by making her students feel comfortable to engage in class discussion.

It's supposed to be soc, but you will get a political science/economics course. Her essay feedback is rude and unhelpful. She doesn't actually teach anything. Everyone in the course was really confused. Some cried! She dismisses you if you don't agree with her. She only has good ratings because she is a nice person, but she is not a good teacher.
Absolutely Useless teacher. It is a waste of money and time to take her class.Her teaching style is very repetitive and as a consequence you learn nothing new. Boring teacher, boring class.

Yildiz is very upbeat & cheerful, great for engaging the class in the course materials. There is quite a lot of in depth reading & writing & presentations required for this class.  At least she is a fair marker.
If you have the opportunity to take a course with her you'll be amazed, best SA prof I've had at SFU. She is engaging and the course ware is heavy but rewarding.

Yildiz is awesome. Has an awesome sociological framework, and brings an interesting perspective to all class discussions. Ive taken a couple of courses with her, and they were both good. The assignments are fair, although challenging. No exams, and no big papers. overall, A grade prof.

Absolutely love her. No final exams, no big papers, only in depth examination of the readings. Not for anyone who thinks they can get a grade just for showing up. She is challenging but so worth it. Plus the group presenting brings food for the class, how cool is that?

Seems to be polarized opinions, either u hate her or love her.  I hated her, but i wouldn't take the chance of possibly liking her.  The odds of hating her are much greater and u'll suffer the consequences all semester! Extremely rude and fake, likes to put students down

ABSOLUTELY HATE HER! Do not recommend her to anyone.  Way too opinionated, just there to prove to the world that she has a PhD and we're only stupid students with no knowledge or intellectual minds of our own.  Has no problem stating that her OPINIONS are correct and yours are wrong, despite the word opinion
She is great a prof and very passionate about the subject. She grades fairly and classes were never boring.

Interesting teaching style -- engages lecture class in dialogue, similar to Socratic method. Obviously very intelligent person, also feminist (at least by my perceptions). TA's definitely a useful supplement to her lectures. you'll need to study in this course!

HOLY SMOKES! is all to have say..I would not even reccommend this course to my worst enenmy its horrible & does not even relate to socilology..its more about history & global politcs work load is enormours 13 items due this sem NO exams..which is okay but mateiral on Isalm is too complex & her book is too 2 difficult to follow no structure

Atasoy is one of the most intellegent people I have ever met.I highly recommend taking any of her classes. I could'nt care less about her structure. Even if I received poor grades from Atasoy it still would have been worth it to hear her views and perspectives about society.

Took this class because I thought it would be interesting; big mistake! Redundant and disconnected readings/lectures, arbitrary marking. She is really nice and seems to know alot but structure of class is disengaging and frustrating. No consistency in marking and doesn't explain what she's looking for AT ALL! Thinks she's being helpful but is not.

Tests are hard and unfair. She tests you on irrelevant material to the course context. Dry and heaving readings. Her lecture notes were neat though. Just read the text and you should do fine. If you need to take this course, do not take it with her, there are other profs that are much easier than she is.
No Comments
No Comments

Yildiz is a dedicated professor who always seeks to ensure that her students understand the material. The reading is quite heavy and so is the coursework, but it's worth it. She definitely has a preferred sociological lens but she's open about her biases. Her diverse background enriches the class.
No Comments

This is one of the most unorganized profs i have had.  The exams are not designed to test your knowledge about the subject. She doesnt post up web notes while wasting your time putting up notes directly from the text up and takes forever to get through a chapter... hmmm i wonder why?

It's an easy class - so take it is you need to boost your GPA or you need credit hours. However, if you are now a fan of feminism then prepare to suffer - she stands up and will accuse all men of being****s! And I have no idea where she gets some of her stats - they are absolutly ridiculous!
best prof ever.

very passionate about what she teaches which makes her very intimidating. if she doesn't like your ideas she will tell you to your face, "NO, you are wrong that's not right". but she is very helpfull & very good at marking things on time, you get everything back one week after handing it in!
i really liked the prof, thought she was excellent and very interested in what she was teaching.
Some discusions were very interesting, the videos were essential to watch, her passion is obvious, but sometimes I felt like she was concentrating on things that seemed incredibly immaterial.

heavy accent, her MC are very tricky, you have to understand the material really well, must attend and write very fast notes in lecture, cuz she goes thru material fast, and she doesn't write things down.some questions are based on lecture

I think people's preoccupation with her accent is really a guise for racism.  There is no way you could not understand what she's saying unless you tried really hard not to.  I found her fun and extremely knowledgeable. Her book, Global Shaping is excelle
femenazi  mc tests are super easy though - just remember blame everything on the straight white male

Course is great, quite easy. Atasoy has a heavy accent though. But you get used to it. The films shown are cool. MC tests are kind of tricky (double negatives & the occational all / some(eg. A&B) / none of the above.

I hate to say it but this is the worst prof i have ever had. MC tests are awful and Atasoy does not even listen when you try to explain why the question should be difft. Obsessed with feminism and the univ of Toronto...maybe she should go back there.

Interesting course, worth taking if only just for the 4 credit hours. Prof was horrible. Lectures were directly out of the textbook, all tests were multiple choice, nothing interesting was added to lecture. If you take Atasoy's course, bring a pillow.

OH MAN WAT RU PEOPLE SAYING! Sociology is the only class i reallly looked forward to going. There aren't that many profs that are dynamic and funny. She was great, and she made 2 hours go by quickly.  The films we saw rocked. And my T.A rocked too.
overall...i really like this course...i like what i learnt... the prof is excellent although i do not agree that m/cs are the best way to evaluate students...her questions sometimes are ODD...
The prof has a great personality and brings lots of energy into class. The course itself interweaves materials from vast different diciplines. Her test is very easy and relevant.
awful...tests were disgusting and the answers to the questions were wrong and unclear..avoid her...course itself is great though...
shes not bad, hard to follow nice interesting woman though
very self absorbed. not innovative ie. lectures are straight from the text book. but her tests are super easy.
Disorganized
her exams are easy, but her lectures are messed up and hard to follow
Loved her!!  She's really funny...in a stupid way.  Her first impression is not always great. I would definately take her again.
No Comments
She is very helpful and freindly. She knows what she is talking about. She is a great prof and a great person to learn from.
No Comments
Very difficult to understand, very strong accent. She DOES laugh at her own joes and she messes with the microphone so that there is a lot of feedback.
Avoid class if you're male. Contrary opinions are NOT welcomed
No Comments
Passionate, knowledgeable...laughs at everything...I agree on the clarity issue...
She tend to stereotype people and offend them accident i guess...~  I agree about the part where she laughs at her own jokes!
she curves . . .  as she marks??
No Comments
good person and class...clarity is another matter.
No Comments
!!!  A difficult teacher to understand.
fun class! prof giggles at everything, fair tests, laid back lectures
Hahaha just sit back and laugh!
she knows her stuff - passionate and interesting
she gigles at things you can't understand
she is hilarious to watch and learn from
No Comments
No Comments
